title: 5 Hour long game due to 5 Trolls in same club on opposite teams

embed.description: 49 points and 82 comments so far on reddit

body:
So this is a Reddit post i recommend you all check out, I'm just reposting here for more attention

5 Players (Smurfs) playing infinitely stacking champions are all in the same club and manage to get 2 and 3 on opposing teams. Them being fed (and have infinite stacks so infinite damage) stall the game out for 5 hours 

Heres a 2 hour clip of said game https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yupP63uSHqw

I hope, for the players stuck in this game, that they get banned for this

It's their fault for not ending the game.

It's not like the scaling champs could one-shot entire minion waves by the 40th minute. I doubt they could even do it by the 90th minute. The people NOT in the clubs helped drag the games out (by not ending) to the point where the people IN the clubs finally had complete control of the game due to scaling (which probably would have happened around the 120th minute).

I'm guessing the club people were on some kind of call since you can see the veigar totally ignoring the kindred even thou kindred is killing his teammate, kindred walks right by it at less than 100 hp and veigar does nothing. 

They were being held hostage lol!!!! but in reality....how are the odds of that actually happening? I mean this people queue on different groups and is not really common to be matched up (I know if you are on the same league or if people is on your friends list you are most likely to get matched against them but the odds are still pretty low). 

Most likely this happpened. 2 groups went into queue, they realized they were playing against each other after selecting champions. They went into call and stall or...fake xD. I will go for fake and say it was a custom game

AHHH okay that makes sense, I misunderstood that.

 Im going to call it fake because matchmaking doesn't work like that, at least in my experiences. If it were higher elo maybe but it said they were smurfs so that would mean it was in bronze/silver/gold which has a really large playerbase and fast matchmaking.

Seems fishy.

I've had some friends who ended up on opposite teams by chance before. It's extremely rare naturally, but I imagine someone could try to force it to happen using the default placement MMR and queuing up at the exact same time to increase the odds.
I know I've ended up on the same team with one or two friends before despite not queueing up together. It definitely can happen.

You can check the Jinx's match history, it was a ranked game, he/she got unlucky as these premades tried to get in to the same game. If they miss, decline the match or dodge, they have 5 people who can dodge after all

I had a game where I was matched against a player in my friend list( I had ~10 friends back then). bronze elo

I went against my friend's cousin and three of his friends one game. We were randomly matched up on opposite teams. That's only happened once though in my 3.5Kish games so the odds are super low of that happening.

Jinx was Bronze 1, it was ranked. From what I understand, it was at a not-so busy time and they all Q'd up together at once, and if they weren't in same champ select, one would just dodge. Since dodge stacks only affect 1 member, all 6 would be able to dodge before the penalty even increased at all. And since they're smurfs, why would they care about LP loss?
An organized group of smurfs could easily stop them from ending the game. Its important to note they are smurfs, so they easily can beat up on the others in the match

Just leave the game.  You have to have x number of leaves (usually 3 or more) in a small amount of time to be sent to Low Priority Queue (you won't get banned as other misinformed people think will happen to you on this thread).  As long as you don't have 2 other leaves in the last month or so, just leave.  

Knowledge is power.
